title: Rose Day: Toggleable special message button

requirements.summary: Add a toggle button inside the Rose Day card to show/hide a special message without triggering the emoji burst click handler.
acceptanceCriteria: A button is visible within the main card content (near the message/signature) with user-facing text in English (e.g., "Show a special message").
Clicking/tapping the button reveals an additional block of text (the special message) within the card.
Clicking/tapping the button again hides the special message (toggle behavior).
Interacting with the button does not unintentionally trigger the page-level click behavior for the emoji burst (i.e., button click does not bubble to the root click handler).
The button and revealed message match the existing page styling (typography/colors/spacing) and remain readable on mobile and desktop.

file_operations.description: Add local toggle state for a "special message" section; render a clearly visible button within the card near the signature that toggles the message; ensure the button onClick uses event.stopPropagation() so it does not trigger the root onClick emoji burst; keep styling consistent with the existing card typography/colors/spacing and responsive readability.

If needed for consistency, add/adjust minimal styles (e.g., for a card-internal button/message block) that align with existing card/typography colors and spacing, without changing any files under frontend/src/components/ui.

requirements.summary: Prepare the frontend for production deployment and document how to obtain a shareable public URL.
acceptanceCriteria: A public URL is available for the deployed site and loads the updated page with the new special-message button.

file_operations.description: Add deployment notes for producing a production build and publishing the site to a shareable public URL using the existing project deployment tooling/workflow (documentation only, no backend changes).
Verify/adjust frontend build scripts if necessary so a production build can be run successfully in CI/deployment environments (no functional app behavior changes).
